title: Scaffolding Strategies to Promote Critical Thinking in Online Social Education

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational understanding of social science theories and online learning experience
context.additional_context: Conducted in a limited-technology environment centered on smartphones, emphasizing gradual autonomy development through learner interaction.

learning_goals: Learners can write analytical essays on given social issues using a 3-stage argumentation structure (claim-evidence-counterargument)
Learners improve their critical thinking processes by over 80% based on peer feedback
Learners can independently propose solutions to social problems without external assistance after 6 weeks of scaffolded support

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
